text: Luis Mayoral Grande (born 10 August 1947) is a Spanish former footballer, who plays for Baltimore Bays as an midfielder. He was professional from 1967 until 1976. He spent the better part of his youth career with Atlético Madrid after starting out at Grenoble. He moved to Albacete Balompié in 1975. He worked for Elche, with which he relegated to the end of La Liga in 1970–1971. He retired at the age of 29. ==Biography== Luis Mayoral was born in Madrid, Spain on August 10, 1947. He was formed at Baltimore Bays. He earned five caps for the Baltimore Bays. He later played for Pontevedra and Albacete Balompié. == References == == External links == * Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Spanish footballers Category:Spanish expatriate footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Baltimore Bays players Category:Boston Beacons players Category:Elche CF players Category:Pontevedra CF footballers Category:Albacete Balompié players Category:National Professional Soccer League (1967) players Category:North American Soccer League (1968–1984) players Category:La Liga players Category:Segunda División players Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States Category:Sportspeople from Madrid
title: Luis Mayoral (footballer)
